KOR 1.title: First Year Korean
KOR 1.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has alreadybeen awarded.
KOR 1.description: The beginning course in Korean. The student acquires a basic knowledge of the grammar, a limited general vocabulary, correct pronunciation, and an ability to read and understand simple texts. Weekly laboratory assignments support and enhance classroom learning.

KOR 3.title: First Year Korean
KOR 3.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has alreadybeen awarded.

KOR 4.title: Second Year Korean
KOR 4.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has alreadybeen awarded.

KOR 5.title: Second Year Korean
KOR 5.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has alreadybeen awarded.

KOR 6.title: Second Year Korean
KOR 6.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has alreadybeen awarded.

KOR 20.title: The New Korean Wave
KOR 20.description: Surveys the major social, economic, and cultural impact of the globalization, and consumption of Korean popular cultural exports and music genres. Adopting a case study approach, the lectures will analyze history of K-pop, its stars, fandom, entertainment industry and media induced tourism.

KOR 60.title: Topics in Korean Television: Drama and Social Reality
KOR 60.description: Inquiry into major topics in Korean history/society reflected in subjects, plots and characters featured in the most popular television dramas. Analyzes mythical heroes, tragic queens, themes of class stratification, family gender roles, marriage customs, corruption, consumerism, and urban life-styles.

KOR 75.title: Introduction to Popular Culture in Korean Film
KOR 75.description: Surveys the historical and anthropological backgrounds behind the popular Korean media industry focusing on Korean blockbusters that have made a major impact in world cinema.

KOR 113.title: Korean Literature Survey
KOR 113.description: Introduces Korea's award winning authors from the 17th century romance to contemporary period women's literature. Topics include class stratification in Yangban society, Japanese occupation, the Korean War, the politics of division, urbanization, prostitution, and alienation.

KOR 120.title: The New Korean Wave
KOR 120.description: Surveys the major social and cultural trends related to globalization and consumption of Korean pop icons. Adopting a case study and interactive approach using video and social media, topics will analyze idol culture, dramas, fashion, music, and celebrity induced tourism.

KOR 139.title: Contemporary Korean Cinema
KOR 139.description: Explores a range of contemporary South Korean films. Different genres and major directors are studied against the backdrop of the nation's dramatic socio-political changes, with particular emphasis on such issues as youth culture, violence, gender, subjection, and nationhood.

KOR 142.title: Introduction to Popular Korean Melodrama
KOR 142.description: A literary survey of popular TV broadcasts focusing on historical dramas, romance, and melodrama based on screenplays, their readings, and translations. Designed for the advanced student interested in how to write scenarios, analyze plots, themes, and characters.

KOR 152.title: Cultures of Protest in South Korea
KOR 152.description: This course engages with diverse media-literature, music, film, digital media-to explore how culture is mobilized as an active site of protest in South Korea. All reading, viewing, and listening material will be available in English translation.

KOR 175.title: Introduction to Popular Culture in Korean Film and TV Dramas
KOR 175.description: A survey of popular Korean cinema from 1990s to present. Focuses on a select number of award winning/block buster films by major directors in the most popular genres including War films, Cold-War espionage films, gangster films, and popular TV dramas.

KOR 181AAZZ.title: Special Topics in Korean Studies
KOR 181AAZZ.description: Special Topics in Korean Studies. Course content varies.

KOR 185.title: Korean Heritage: Management and Development
KOR 185.description: Investigates the cultural heritage industry in contemporary South Korea such as national preservation laws, tourist development, and the commercialization of the arts and traditions. Case studies analyze ethnic theme parks, festivals, museums/monuments, commodification of religions, and travel destinations.

KOR 199.title: Independent Studies
KOR 199.prereq_description: Upper-division standing; completion of 2 upper-division Korean courses; one
KOR 199.comments: Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA for the preceeding three quarters and are limited to 5 units per quarter and 30 units total in all 98/99/198/199/199AA-ZZ courses combined.
